title: Nicola McLean's brutal Coleen Rooney takedown with wild claims over 'harming' Becky Vardy's baby
text:

Nicola McLean launched a brutal takedown of Coleen Rooney with wild claims on today's This Morning.

The reality TV star revealed close pal Rebekah Vardy is "absolutely devastated" after Coleen Rooney claimed someone had been using her Instagram account to sell private stories to the press.

Nicola revealed pregnant Rebekah had been subjected to horrific abuse, including death threats, which she believes is causing stress and could harm her unborn baby.

She claimed Coleen actively "chose to put a pregnant woman under this much stress" in a scathing attack.

Nicola then turned the tables on Coleen, who is married to footballer Wayne Rooney, by claiming she is "used to being betrayed".

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

Speaking on This Morning, she said: "We’ve got a pregnant woman here, no matter who it is, who shouldn't be subjected to all this abuse.

"Coleen Rooney, she’s a mother, she knows this is not acceptable. Until Rebekah Vardy is proven guilty come off it, this is not OK."

Nicola clashed with presenter Vanessa Feltz during the debate on whether there should be preferential treatment for expectant mothers.

She said: "Forget who it is. Whether it’s a celebrity, a WAG or a normal person. Pregnancy, we all know stress can cause so much upset. We’ve just had a report from psychiatrists not that long ago that it it can affect the baby's brain."

On the trolling, she added: "I know I've been reading it personally. It’s horrific. 'Hope the unborn baby dies. Hope they both die'. This level of abuse is horrific, especially if your pregnant."

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: ITV)

Nicola even hit out at This Morning for giving airtime to the WAGatha Christie debate.

On Coleen's claims, she said: "I don’t think she knows it's Rebekah. She’s seven months pregnant. I think it’s hypocritical any show talks about mental health and wellbeing but it's OK to slam her because she’s not a likeable a person.

"Coleen said it has been going on for years. Let it wait."

This Morning host Ruth Langsford defended the show by insisting they were "not slamming" Becky.

Nicola went on to insist Dr Ranj would back her up and that mothers have to protect themselves during pregnancy.

She said: "[Coleen] could have stopped this. She didn’t need to do this. I’m not saying Coleen is a bad person. I don't know her.

"As a mother, we are aware of what happens when you post something. She knew that and chose to put a pregnant woman under this much stress."

(Image: ITV)

At the end of the interview, furious Nicola added: "If Coleen wants to be this outspoken why isn’t she outing other people in her life as well?"

This Morning viewers took to Twitter to blast Nicola for her attack on Coleen.

One viewer said: "How embarrassing was Nicola?! So angry, you would’ve thought she was the one being called out and not Rebekah. Glad @RuthieeL told her!"

"Was Nicola actually talking for Rebekah or just making the whole thing about her? Also unnecessary to bring Colleens relationship into it," added another.

A third said: "Of course Nicola would defend Rebekah would she be as forgiving if someone leaked a story on her"

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

It took just minutes for Becky to respond to Coleen's claims - hitting back with a strong denial of the allegations.

Tweeting her response to Coleen's statement, Rebekah said: "As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this.

"I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for.

"If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped.

(Image: Twitter)

"Over the years various people have had access to my insta & just this week I found I was following people I didn't know and have never followed myself

"I'm not being funny but I don't need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?

I liked you a lot Coleen & I'm so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I'm heavily pregnant.

"I'm disgusted that I'm even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened."

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: Rebekah Vardy's close friend claimed abuse of the pregnant WAG was causing stress to her baby before launching a scathing attack on Coleen Rooney
